Posted By: Axelle (4/27/2012 3:49:33 PM)

posts.post_content:
5 mana, for a 5/5 flyer is decent enough, especially when one of those colors is ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). Then you add the sac ability, and hexproof to it and this is one incredible legendary creature! I pulled this in my pre-release packs and based my deck around it. I never got to use it, but since my opponent was playing black the first round, would've been game changing had I been able to.
  
   
I may change my [thrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thrun) around and make this the commander with hexproof stuff, or I may put it into [Uril](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uril) for some enchantment beatdown.
posts.html:
5 mana, for a 5/5 flyer is decent enough, especially when one of those colors is . Then you add the sac ability, and hexproof to it and this is one incredible legendary creature! I pulled this in my pre-release packs and based my deck around it. I never got to use it, but since my opponent was playing black the first round, would've been game changing had I been able to.

I may change my thrun around and make this the commander with hexproof stuff, or I may put it into Uril for some enchantment beatdown.

Posted By: MANABURNWASGOOD (4/30/2012 7:00:01 AM)
Rating:

@StoicChampion
It took some time to figure out how to dismantle your combination, but Phantasmal Image can do it. If I can't cast blue spells, then I will use black to get it into my graveyard and reanimate it. You can save yourself with ghostway, but I can deplete you of those by casting/reanimating a clone each turn.
You need a painter's servant too...and while you're at it, why not add a douse?
I think Magus of the Tabernacle gets around this too.

@igniteice
Note that not all of those work, because there is a rule of law in play, but a couple of those are super.

posts.post_content:
Well, she's the toughest fighter...  
My favorite of Avacyn's three angels by a long shot. Looks set to be an efficient ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) beater in regular decks and as a Commander (Voltron, most likely). Well, those of you who missed [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) will hopefully find something to like here-

Expect to see her a \*lot\* in the next couple of years.

posts.post_content: It's weird, but in my green-white deck this little lady ALWAYS turns up. Only got one and she's always my third or fourth card drawn. Usually she gets a [Shield of the Oversoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shield of the Oversoul) to help make her that much harder to deal with too. Generally though, she's just a brilliant beatstick, but I have to give her some kudos for always wanting to get into the fray fast.
